alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Portage; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 6:38PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wood, southern Portage, northwestern Calumet, Winnebago, Waushara and southwestern Waupaca Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 637 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Shortville to 9 miles northeast of Pittsville to 7 miles southeast of Whiting to Chain O` Lakes-King to near High Cliff State Park. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hartman Creek State Park, Chain O` Lakes-King, Northern Lake Winnebago and High Cliff State Park around 645 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Central Lake Winnebago, Napowan Scout Camp, Plainfield, Wautoma, Babcock and Redgranite. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Calumet; Portage; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago; Wood
